page.title: 11FARMING-A FARM VISIT(CONT'D)
page.content: {ANIMALS Mr Chapman now keeps beef cattle which he buys and sells mostly at Yeovil market. They are a Hereford-Fresian cross. Artificial inemination is used to avoid keeping a bull on the farm. There are 4 saanen goats kept for milking. The frozen milk is sold in local shops, not needing to be pasteurised and keeping for 6 weeks. 2 large white pigs are kept, feeding mainly on scraps. These are killed and the meat sold, though some is kept for the family. Eggs are supplied by 8 Golden Comet hens. Visits from the vet are rare, as Mr Chapman uses homeopathic remedies. Help during the year comes from 3 dogs {BUILDINGS The farm buildings are near the house and include a large barn with a slurry pit beneath, cowsheds and pigsties.
